posts.text: :sharedchannel:

If you've already tried sharing your channel with another org you still need to officially request the approval of a Shared Channel between VMware and another Organization through the Request Form @ http://url/slacksharedchannel.  This is required for tracking/auditing purposes.   Each Shared Channel request must be approved by Admins in each org to complete.
thank you

Hey folks. I have a customer asking about "commercial support for RabbitMQ". How does that work? Do you have to use one of the three offerings on Pivotal Network? It looks like "Pivotal RabbitMQ" is no longer supported, the K8s one is not GA yet, and the PAS one is not relevant in this case.

replies.text: we have three flavors: one is OSS bits supported by us, that the customer downloads and manages. Then the BOSH tile (that's GA), and a K8s version that's a beta. They are described in further down on this page: https://tanzu.vmware.com/rabbitmq

So the OSS bits look like they are EOL
https://network.pivotal.io/products/pivotal-rabbitmq/ (edited)
Unless I'm looking at the wrong thing
Is the OSS support offering EOL?
Hi James, we have a Commerical Run anywhere RMQ, a bosh tile release and we are soon to GA a K8s release, we also offer OSS support
Alright, sounds like Rabbit is still a thing, that's good. Do you know who my account exec and I could talk to to get some details? Customer just wants support for a 5 node cluster running on Windows
ahhh. I responded in the #rabbitmq-core-eng channel.  Also sent you a DM, James

posts.text: RabbitMQ 3.8.x bits are not on PivNet. Do customers actually download Rabbit from us when they are just buying OSS support? Or do they download from rabbitmq.com? I'm trying to figure out why only 3.7.x is on PivNet. Maybe that was the old way of doing things?

replies.text: sent you a DM

posts.text: https://www.businessinsider.com/yugabyte-hires-pivotal-bill-cook-new-ceo-2020-5
How much max data node/DC can be added in GemFire cluster? We have a Govt customer , who may have large remote nodes in a few hundread.

replies.text: ^ @pulkitc
Limit is very high, long. Practically we have order of 200 in prod at max in single cluster (edited)
Thanks Pulkit. How we can support more than 200?
You can. Their is  no technical limitation. You just need to ensure you have high bandwidth network to handle the load
ok. Hope it should handle load of around 500 to 1000 clusters
When you say 1000 clusters you mean nodes/members?

@rasrivastava – At the largest scales, the use-cases, non-functional requirements, predicted volumes/TPS over time, and underlying hw capabilities are very important to understand.  Can you gather some additional details such as:

Also, do they already have this hw, or is a purchase still in the planning phase?  They might benefit greatly from "right-sizing" their servers based on the expected usage.  For example, 100 256GB servers is usually a much better choice than 800 32GB servers.  We have customer evaluating (some now using) 768GB, 1TB, and 2TB servers, with the understanding that at the largest scales, it really helps to plan for both vertical and horizontal scalability. (edited)
ok sure
We have customers running clusters hosting 10's of TB of data in a single cluster but as Gideon noted the use cases and requirements are really important for sizing decisions.

posts.text: Are there docs for Postgres for K8s?  I found documentation for the beta releases in a search on docs.pivotal.io, but the link returns a page not found message.

replies.text: We have a channel: #vmware-postgres-on-kubernetes but here’s the staging docs for our upcoming release: http://postgres-kubernetes.cfapps.io/1-0/index.htmland the beta docs: http://postgres-kubernetes.docs.pivotal.io/0-4/index.html
Thank you!
You’re welcome!
@rglithero please note the docs are not ready for the 1.0.0, they are still in draft. Some new changes are still in docs PR and have not merged. (edited)
@Lena Hunter got it thanks
Question:  the docs mention GKE and VMW Enterprise PKS as deployment targets for Postgres.   Enterprise PKS is now TKG-i.  Is that the only edition of TKG that will be supported?

@rglithero Docs are updated for 1.0 now: http://postgres-kubernetes.docs.pivotal.io/1-0/index.htmlAlthough the generic link, http://postgres-kubernetes.docs.pivotal.io/ will always point to the latest rev of the docs.
You're right, it does say TKG-i specifically, but we will support all TKG flavors.
ok, thank you

@pbopardikar and team help customers and our SE teams with enablement if you are looking for help.
The customer is evaluating RabbitMQ, but due to some message ordering requirements they are also evaluating kafka.  Just trying to understand our positioning and still trying to make Rabbit work.
If anyone can help me with this RabbitMQ use case, that would be great.
@dcarwin can we point to an example for ordered messages with RMQ Streams

As it’s unreleased and officially unannounced we don’t have a customer use case but here’s the overview deck which gives more details https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1kfgFdwhWIUoYWnreXLCCSy0rLw5dkEgtagKjbIYEi8s/edit#slide=id.g8294c00475_0_0 cc @acogoluegnes @knilsson @dianacorbacho

streams are immutable once written and thus cannot be re-ordered. That said there is currently no mechanism in place to de-duplicate retried publishes. Is there any more detail w.r.t their ordering requirements?

posts.text: @Shawn Greer
Afternoon. I'm trying to do a bit of digging on some SKU/consumption information. What was the Pivotal Services Suite (SKU SSS-1021) rebranded to, and how is consumption of the product measured?

replies.text: It split up into individual data skus. Most licensed by core.
what about on a renewal?

The Services Suite SKU has been deprecated, and the unit of measure has been changed to cores/year.   It's available for renewals if the customer wants it and the contract allows, but it requires executive approval (contact @schubert, VP Eng).  We've seen this happen where the renewal negotiations are already in flight with the old SKU/UoM (i.e., it's too awkward to start over w/the new SKU), or if there's another product in the services suite that the customer needs as well. (edited)
Also, keep in mind that the services sku doesn't have the entitlement for K8s if the customer ever wants to go in that direction
In the common case, switch to new sku(s) at renewal time.
Is there a write-up/link somewhere to the new products that Pivotal Services Suite split into?
https://confluence.eng.vmware.com/display/TD/Tanzu+Data+Services

The following Pivotal Services are included with a license to Pivotal Services Suite
- MySQL for Pivotal Platform  [<-new SKU for this Tanzu SQL (MYSQL) [VMs]]
- Redis, which means: [GONE - replace with Tanzu GemFire [VMs] and new REDIS-compatible API - ping Pulkit for more info]
- RabbitMQ, which means:  [<-new SKU for this - TANZU RABBITMQ]
- Concourse for Pivotal Platform [ <- IDK - this is not Data Services Pillar] (edited)

posts.text: @channel Hey All, VMware Tanzu SQL with MySQL for Kubernetes 1.0.0 is live on Tanzu Net!   It is my pleasure to thank the @tanzu-mysql-team for their hard work, countless renames  and time spent producing this GA, amazing work everyone! Special thanks to @Kris and @Rachel for walking us through the Release Process. We can't forget to thank @bklein @djane and @chriswong for creating top notch documentation for this and beta releases of this product. Congrats everyone for getting this release out the door!   MySQL for Kubernetes 1.0.0 targets the following key customer problems within a Kubernetes Operator Patterned framework:

@channel Tanzu Rabbitmq for VMS (aka the tile) version 2.0 LTS is live on Tanzunet. This version works with both TAS LTS 1 and TAS LTS 2. It has a more flexible rabbitmq configuration than previous tile releases by exposing rabbitmq configuration file and tier 1 plugins. Kudos to the rabbit platform team for the effort. special shout for @ferozjilla @coro @dansari @kura and @ablease for doing most of the work
Quick PnP question - do the minimum order quantities apply if a customer is buying specific data products on top of a Data Starter Pack?

replies.text: What do you mean specifically by data starter pack?The "Tanzu Data Services Pack" starter park has a strict limit of 1 qty per a customer which means it only provides exactly 30 Cores RabbitMQ, 24 Cores Tanzu SQL, 12 cores Tanzu GemFire. All of those are technically above the minimums for the standalone SKUs.

Or are you asking, if a customer purchases 1 Tanzu Data Services Pack, if they want to purchase additional Tanzu SQL than do they have to still purchase 18 cores on top of it? So in stead of being able to do 24 + 1 cores, they have to do 24 + 18 total? (edited)
The second option - if a customer purchases 1 Tanzu Data Services Pack, are they able to purchase 1 Tanzu SQL core on top of the 24, or do they have to buy 18?
Sorry, been thinking starter and it slipped into the product name I used .

That's a good question. There's nothing that explicitly states if that's allowed or not. By the book, it would be that only 24+18 is allowed - but to be honest the minimums have been hard to actually be enforced through the many different sales system.There's one side of it that the data services pack is still only meant to be a starter pack, such that if it's going beyond that than we would prefer a customer just purchase the individual offerings. In some cases it's cheaper. If they are only using Tanzu SQL, than $36k for a starter pack work sout to $1.5k a Core but the standalone is $1k a Core. However if they are using two of the entitlements in the starter pack or 3, it sort of becomes a built in discount for the first 24 Cores.I'll ask the question to the PLs to get their opinion.
I've asked the question, so just waiting on responses. I'll follow up once there is a clear answer and add it into the TDS PnP FAQ.
@alturner Is this a general question or is it something from a specific customer or opportunity? (edited)

posts.text: @here - we have an opportunity at Citi for the following: design and deploy an NLP logic (covering 10 languages) on top of existing English language - in house implementation - bring in data scientists to pair with the Citi data scientist

replies.text:
I don't have an actual win.  The only thing I have is a very old write up i did with the data science team about a POC for extracting text and features from retirement plan docs.  I wouldn't present as is, because you'd likely use different tooling today.  HTH!
https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/0B0uLzDqCvD0bYUx6ZFlWUnJsbGM/edit?usp=sharing[…]02503&resourcekey=0-_nDkmG6axjDhQRzS4RGLFg&rtpof=true&sd=true (edited)
@ranger @wjung @Kevin do we have any assets or content to help @Paul Lizon?

Thanks @rglithero - in addition to my ask above, do we have an reasons why an org should move forward building this logic internally rather than integrating a 3rd party tool @costas @ranger @wjung @Kevin

@Paul Lizon it’s about the “standard” build or buy dilemma; using pre-built models can be a useful approach as there are offerings out in the market from established services like Azure, IBM, Google,  Amazon or any other 3rd party. However, these models are often for quite generic functions. These may not be specific enough for the functions that would bring the most value to them, and they still require software engineers who can do the work of integrating them with existing software systems. (edited)

@Paul Lizon I've included a deck summarizing our capabilities here in case it may help (slide 7 is a 1 slide summary of the case study that Bob shared, and slide 8 contains another NLP engagement that we delivered in the public sector) https://onevmw-my.sharepoint.com/:p:/g/personal/wjung_vmware_com/ESiumA2czT9JjKSCb97XDa8B6-wuteOCsvJWIT6RblH9aw?e=eoi8Ck (edited)

If yes,  what requirements we need to gather from the customer in order to understand if GPDB will be a perfect fit or not? (edited)

replies.text: Awesome, Thanks @macedol Do we have some internal guidelines for me to learn more or at least a questionnaires we can share with the customer?  FWIW, As of now for us, it is just a Hadoop on top of VSAN opportunity so wanted to understand more about the options we have if we will propose GPDB.
HD on vSAN what a bad idea! hahaha
Which country is the customer?
Jordan
You need to find out who is the Data rep for the customer and he will add some Data Engineers to work with you
It is surprisingly that Cloudera is ok with this architecture haha, I was surprised to see VSAN on their slides.
Cloudera will sell anything that would minimally work

posts.text: It also depends on the stack Cloudera in bringing, today they are more than just Hadooop.
You can propose a that all SQL workload be on GPDB and other stuff on CDH. GPDB is a much better SQL engine.

posts.text: hey all do we have an offer for implementing postgress from our vmware tanzu data services pack we can send with an offer for the pack? like a service sku (edited)

replies.text:
@Cooper90s a side-note on Tanzu Data Services Pack from Tanzu Data Services PnP FAQ:
Tanzu Data Services Pack includes 30 Cores of Tanzu RabbitMQ, 24 cores of Tanzu SQL and 12 cores of Tanzu GemFire. Restricted to 1 quantity per customer. This is not a mix and match, it is for this specific count of Cores for each product. While this "Pack" is available, it is only intended as a Tanzu Data Services introduction offering. The TDS products should be sold individually when a customer needs more than what is available in the single qty of the Tanzu Data Services "Pack".  If the customer is interested on Postgres only, it would be beneficial to use the Tanzu SQL SKU instead.
Thx Kostas!

posts.text: We unfortunately don't have any packaged services SKUs around the data products, it's all T&M.

replies.text: @alturner I believe we  have packaged skus for services @Kevin can you please confirm ?
Link to the data sheets for the Data services skus are here : https://tanzu.vmware.com/content/tanzu-labs/vmware-tanzu-labs-datasheets
Those really aren't service packages for an outcome. They're pre-portioned T&M.

Well . . . . We're "packaging" our expertise and process,  rather than a guaranteed outcome, but positive outcomes are something DataTx has an excellent track record delivering (and who does "fixed-cost" services anymore?).

The original question was around deployment services - if the customer buys Postgres and (implicitly) DMS, what will we charge to get it running. We have packages for that stuff for platform bits, not for the data bits.
I agree completely that any more complex outcome is not something we can package, but the basic deployment stuff doesn't sound like an unreasonable request.
It's also not the work we want the whizz kids from DataTX spending time on
Point! And, point!
Why do we need services to get DMS running?
Shouldn't it be easy enough for anyone to do it
Ahem . . . .
DMS should be easy enough for anyone with vSphere Admin knowledge to do, but there is definitely a barrier to entry for not Admins

posts.text: @alturner I believe we  have packaged skus for services @Kevin can you please confirm ?
Link to the data sheets for the Data services skus are here : https://tanzu.vmware.com/content/tanzu-labs/vmware-tanzu-labs-datasheets

@Cooper90s a side-note on Tanzu Data Services Pack from Tanzu Data Services PnP FAQ:
Tanzu Data Services Pack includes 30 Cores of Tanzu RabbitMQ, 24 cores of Tanzu SQL and 12 cores of Tanzu GemFire. Restricted to 1 quantity per customer. This is not a mix and match, it is for this specific count of Cores for each product. While this "Pack" is available, it is only intended as a Tanzu Data Services introduction offering. The TDS products should be sold individually when a customer needs more than what is available in the single qty of the Tanzu Data Services "Pack".  If the customer is interested on Postgres only, it would be beneficial to use the Tanzu SQL SKU instead.
@costas is there a way to get our hands on the teaching and demo stuff created for DBS Hack2Hire Singapore

replies.text: I’ll DM you

posts.text: RPMs are only RHEL. VMs I was assuming DMS was the track

replies.text: Is you are creating the VM using the RPM then you are correct
What is the option to use Photon?
Also our smattering of operating systems depending on delivery flavor is super annoying
DMS uses photon. It is a management plane for vsphere
ah yes… There was a reason I was moving away from that… I have to go back and look at it again.  Thanks for the reminder.
With the rpms. No FIPs and STIG config is 100% up to the user.

Tanzu Trust Artifacts https://confluence.eng.vmware.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=CNA&title=Tanzu+Trust+Artifacts
As Alex said earlier, the data artifacts is far from complete

Just to add another wrinkle to this discussion, I work with an IC customer and they asked about being able to install products in STIG mode. I realize this is a much bigger ask than documenting compliance.
@csylvester long time! is this for greenplum with our customer your at currently? How did they get around it not being STIG? (edited)
Hi Chris. It is for GP. And currently there is no requirement for STIG compliance (it is already a highly restricted env). I have run into STIG more on the DoD side and not as much in the IC.

posts.text:
@channel – Data Management for VMware Tanzu 1.2.0 is live on Tanzu Net! Congratulations and thanks to the following teams for the efforts involved in making this happen-
·      Documentation
·      Engineering
·      Product Design
·      Technical Architecture
·      Release ManagementSome of the notable features include:
·      Data Management for VMware Tanzu 1.2.0 now includes support for these PostgreSQL 13.6.0 version.
·      Enhanced Log Management
·      Flexibility in Managing Environments
·      Flexibility in Managing Database InstancesFor a more comprehensive list of features and to gather more information on how these features work, please refer to the latest release notes and our product documentation.

@mapbu-data-pm Are the TAS Data Services tiles also available as BOSH releases? e.g. I saw MySQL seems to be available in the open source.I'm reviewing the position of open source CF versus TAS, trying to reason about a customers options for on-platform data services in the open source CF world.

replies.text: To my knowledge only the MySQL one is, possibly Rabbit?
https://github.com/pivotal-cf/cf-rabbitmq-releaseThere's something for RabbitMQ.
gemfire & redis are commercial only?
@majohn or @Nainesh could comment there

cf-rabbitmq-release is indeed open source (and we know it had some users in the past, not sure if it still does) but this is not the full tile - the multitenant service broker is OSS but the on-demand one is not. The tile also includes the service-gateway which is not OSS (it's an optional feature but important for some users)
Yes GemFire and Redis are commercial only offerings.  we recently got the product guide updated to drop the line which mentioned OSS support for Redis.

Happy to answer more questions about this slide, since while I didn't create it, it is the basis for the strategy that Dave and I shopped around for a while (I am the Velero PM and covering TKG data protection as well)

posts.text: Hey team! I have a customer that historically made quarterly payments via Pivotal’s quoting system. Now we are unsure of how we can keep them on the same plan with VMW’s system. Has anyone figured this out yet? If we can’t keep them on quarterly (or move them to monthly) they will churn.

replies.text: @alexa is there a specific SKU they are churning on here? As well, @Kris may know a contact in the billing/payments group to reach out to for this.
I've no idea on the billing/payments side, it's beyond my context. @cminjae from the pricing team would likely know who to go to.
@Nick this is a Pivotal Data customer (they purchase prod and non prod)
I was thinking more specifically, what product. Greenplum, GemFire, rabbit, SQL?

Prod and Non-Prod means it can only be "Pivotal Data Suite". So that leaves either Greenplum, GemFire, MySQL for TAS, OSS Support for Spring Cloud Data Flow, and Postgres (it's a weird set of entitlements).
The SKUs are:
That would be Pivotal Data Suite. So it's with a high likelyhood either Greenplum (70%) or GemFire (30%).

This won't change the billing problem. @alexa I suggest either asking @cminjae directly, or asking in #tanzu-pnp. One of those locations should surface someone who knows more about billing and payments.
There's a related email distribution list as well, pnp-tanzu@vmware.com
So this is MNTN! Interesting. That's very likely Greenplum then. They run it on AWS. We work with them a lot.

@alexa Has MNTN ever considered the Hourly Greenplum on AWS? I know that there are issues due to them running a custom environment.. but this would give them lots of flexibility on payments. @gspiegelberg FYI
@Kris I’m not sure, I don’t work with them directly on the strategy, just assisting with the quoting and booking. @aewy is the data rep strategizing with them, so he would be the right person to ask

posts.text:
1. You can now open a HelpNow+ ticket using the "/ticket create" command. 
2. You can also go the #oasis channel or browse to HelpNow+ @ https://help.vmware.com. 
3. If your regional office has one you can also walk over to your local Oasis bar for in-person IT support. 
4. If you need Slack-specific assistance you can go to the #slack-help channel.

Hello TDS. Fed Data Team is working with an Air Force prospect. The Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) Sales and Pre Sales Team are bidding on a High Performance Computing (HPE) hardware system. I was wondering if we have any case studies or past performance running GP on HPE hardware. Specifically around GP on HPE GPUs and doing Big Data analytics? If so, could you please point me to these case studies or any white papers specific to GP on HPE hardware? Thank you

replies.text: ^ @Ivan Novick @raghavanve

We don't have any collateral regarding HPE
Hi Ivan thank you.

posts.text: Hello TDS Fed Data Team is working on a Request for Information (RFI) with the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). The NOAA RFI calls out a request for connecting or interfacing to Installatron a one-click web application installer that enables top web applications to be instantly installed and effortlessly managed. Has Installatron been used to manage Greenplum or Postgres in a web application?

replies.text: a quick look and it seems like this is just a simple wrapper and testing framework for common open source apps - i don’t recall any of our customers using it however, there’s nothing here that indicates it would either hurt or help with our products. i feel comfortable saying that applications using this can connect effortlessly to postgres or greenplum or any of our data products
Thank you Jacque.

posts.text: VMWare Tanzu SQL with MySql for Kubernetes 1.6.1 is live on Tanzu Net and Tanzu CLI (carvel package). Thanks to the engineering, docs and release mgmt. teams for their efforts in making this happen. This is a Postgres patch version update.Features -
@slack-automation1 has renamed the channel from "mapbu-data-services" to "vmware-data-services" using the channel management tool. Learn more.
Would we have any interest/ability or has anyone helped a customer work through migrating data from Access to Sharepoint?

replies.text: im not sure what the goal would be here - access is a database and sharepoint more of a google drive thing - do you mean “create a web app” from an access database?
No, I figured it wasn't really something we would do. They essentially just want help speeding up the migration of the data between the two. We're reaching at this point
yea - it’s low end stuff, could we help sure - i’d bring in a partner for that
but access is small data and could be put in literally anything (mysql/postgres/sql server/etc)

They are consolidating 3 Access DBs to one location to reduce data duplication and errors.. so I'm not sure how heavy of a lift it will be but... I'll let them know they can likely find a more suitable partner for this stuff. Thank you, Jacque!

fwiw - Eon Collective is one of our partners and does a lot of this kind of thing (even has some automated tools to help). they could be introduced directly or we could bring them in underneath the dataTx umbrella
Oh good to know!

posts.text:
VMware Data Solutions Webinar Alert!
Unlock the potential of your data with VMware Data Solutions
https://whitepapers.theregister.com/paper/view/18756/unlock-the-potential-of-your-data-with-vmware-data-solutions
March 30th - 12 Noon ET
Recording link will be available after the eventTimothy Prickett Morgan of The Next Platform will sit down with Ivan Novick, Director of Product Management for Greenplum at VMware, and Jacque Istok, VP of Sales for VMware Data Solutions, to talk about how this data analytics platform has come together, been tuned for VMware vSphere, and how enterprises are taking advantage of it both on premises and in the cloud.

Announcing the first full draft of the Data Science Playbook! This is a beach effort to better prepare Labs practitioners for data science/ML engagements. After iterating and vetting it against DS-focused engagements we would like to publish it publicly with the goals of getting more DS engagements and establishing Labs as thought leaders in this space. We are actively seeking--nay, begging for--feedback! Please comment according to the instructions on the title page. Share widely, especially among anyone who has worked in data science/ML (can be in other areas of VMware, not just Labs). https://docs.google.com/document/d/1gIAOjFwkNDfNYc1Bq2zI-kbGIXl4ciLFc4MYwhoxSiY/edit#heading=h.f2p2zzrrseut

posts.text:
Upcoming webinar alert
How to Build Resilient Architecture for Fast Paced Digital Transactions Using VMware GemFire
The world of payments is changing rapidly. The FedNow service is expected soon which aims to provide a modern instant payment solution for all participating financial institutions. Through this webinar you learn how to use VMware GemFire to securely write payments in two availability zones and speed up the downstream processing. https://bit.ly/3VqQur3

Upcoming webinar alert
Getting Started with Open Source Analytics Using Rocky Linux and Greenplum
In 2023 the value and also the challenges for creating new data analytics projects have increased. The technology landscape is large and unwieldy with a mixture of Open Source and Proprietary technologies covering thousands of products and projects.In this webinar we present a simple platform for analytics which is fully open source as well as enterprise ready consisting of Rocky Linux platform and featuring Greenplum Database. With just these two components users can provide business value quickly storing and analyzing data at scale and in an Open Source way. https://bit.ly/42LLsIn
https://vmware.slack.com/archives/C01U0T1JJJF/p1685711941200609
